name: To Kill a Mockingbird
title: To Kill a Mockingbird by Harper Lee
description: A novel about the serious issues of race, class, gender, and justice in the Deep South, told through the perspective of a young girl named Scout Finch.

title: 1984 by George Orwell
description: A dystopian novel set in a totalitarian society ruled by the Party and its leader, Big Brother, which uses surveillance, censorship, and propaganda to control its citizens.

name: Moby-Dick
title: Moby-Dick by Herman Melville
description: The story of Captain Ahab’s obsessive quest to seek revenge on Moby Dick, a massive white whale that severed Ahab’s leg, a story of obsession, revenge, and the nature of humanity.

name: Pride and Prejudice
title: Pride and Prejudice by Jane Austen
description: A romantic novel that deals with the issues of love, marriage, and social class through the relationship between Elizabeth Bennet and Mr. Darcy.

name: The Martian
title: The Martian by Andy Weir
description: A Sci-fi novel About the story of mark wattney astranought stuck on mars alone, struggling to survive
